I was amazed at how the flavors tasted like the real thing. It was soooooo smooth and creamy! I would definitely recommend coming here over any ice cream shops if you are around the area or better yet make the trek here!

Reviews.Author: Ra
Reviews.Content: Great flavors of gelato! Love how unique all the flavors are. The honeycomb candy is really good too.

Reviews.Author: christine
Reviews.Content: A lot of innovative flavors that you don't get else where.  The gelato is of great quality, better than most gelato places in LV.

Reviews.Author: Terri
Reviews.Content: When Desyree Alberganti closed the doors of her original Art of Flavors on February 28, 2015, her gelato fans near and far were heartbroken.  Almost six months later, happy days are here again!  Today is the grand opening of Desy's new gelateria and it's like she never left. I was fortunate to attend a Friends and Family sneak peek last night with some other friends where Desy, her husband Luigi, and the rest of the family welcomed all with open arms and lots of gelato plus other treats on the menu.    GELATO flavors in the case last night: peanut butter chocolate strawberries n cream pear and gorgonzola rosemary creme brulee nutella rocky road dulce de leche & chocolate cookies n cream fiori di latte  SORBETTO flavors, all gluten-free and vegan: chocolate  mango  passion fruit coconut  We had a chance to sample the FAT ELVIS:  peanut butter gelato, strawberry, banana compote, bacon candy, and peanuts as well as the  BOSCAIOLA:  raspberry sorbetto, mint pesto, and fruit.  A new item is the ORGANIC DARK TART CHERRY soda, also gluten free and vegan.    Desy is also serving up pastries, espresso, cappuccino, affogato, and SHAKES with a gelato base.  Come see what you've been missing if you've never had this gelato and welcome back to those who've been waiting.  We're happy you've returned, Desy!  Gelato/Sorbetto Prices: 4 oz. - $4 6 oz - $5.50 12 oz. - $7 16 oz. - $8.50

Reviews.Author: Suki
Reviews.Content: I was curious to try their Ube marshmallows as it was posted on their Instagram page. It was Thanksgiving time and I wanted to do a different topping for my sweet potato casserole. The Ube marshmallows had a stunning appearance at first, but failed miserably from melting into the casserole. It held well in my hot coffee and was my alternative for sugar. A smooth, creamy topping for any steamy beverage! Much love to this delightful treat :)  It was such a tease for me to even stop by, since I was still recovering from a sinus cold and had to stay away from the infamous, wonderful gelato selection that looked oh so tempting to taste. I did have some self control this day and said no.. no .. well... no I shouldn't. And left with a strong desire to come back and try their gelato!!! And so I did.  My second trip was really for Christmas gifts. Again, I saw a post on their IG aka Instagram page of their custom gift baskets. And that checked off a few special love ones on my list.   I walked in and a sweet, patient lady named Desyree greeted me warmly and asked if I ever been here before. First time for gelato and I was handed spoon after spoonful of samples of her flavors of the day as well as any flavors that tickled my fancy. I love the limitless sampling, but after bites of a few flavors, I couldn't differentiate on what was what and what I just tasted before. It did make the most flavor one stand out when it came down to choosing one or two.   White Chocolate Macadamia Rocky Road. Blew my foodie mind into heart pieces. My first thought... Fresh ingredients, clean finish. If Desyree stock these at my nearby grocery store, I would buy the whole shelf and buy a mini freezer to stock them myself! I know.. just the thought of that, gave me a major brain freeze. Ouch. Til this day, I still think about this particular flavor and I'm hoping it makes a comeback one of these days.   Desyree was helpful and kind to show me all her different styles of gift baskets. Starting from $12-$75 and what is in each basket. She told me if I wanted to replace an item with a different item, I could. I can also add a gift certificate or even take anything out if I didn't like it. I did a few changes and customized three $75 gift baskets. All of them had peppermint barks, almond covered in chocolate, honey comb, nutella biscuit, gelatology mug, pretzel covered in chocolate, nutella marshmallows, polvorones, chocolate clusters almond turrone, sugar cookies, and a gift certificate.   I witnessed firsthand the expression on my brother's face trying out all these goodies. I was sweating bullets, my heart beating nervously.. as he took the first bite of the sugar cookies. His eyes lit up like a Christmas tree and said... oh wow... this is something else. One by one, he was impressed. I let him and his gf enjoy, but deep down I was like damn I wanna bite too! Sad face and all.. still no luck. I did taste a few the next day after he asked if I tried any at the store and I said no. It was light, flavorful, not too sugary, and simply YUMMY. Love their sugar cookies. This is coming from someone that thinks sugar cookies are boring and tasteless. Even their frosting was ever so cooling. A winter wonderland in your very own home!  The gift basket, itself was deliciously arranged! I was even a little bit jelly, not having one myself. But it is the Season of Giving and that's what it's all about. Making people happy and sharing moments together. People go through hard times and it's nice to find a place where you can just enjoy a few bites of happiness and forget about some things. Gelatology was able to fill our tummies with goodies and making it extra special for the Holidays.   This place is a few stores down from Serenade, in the Southwest Marketplace plaza. If I was in a foodie kinda mood, I would get a quick bite at Rice N Noodle, then get my dessert on at Gelatology, while taking a nice, hot soothing tea or coffee to go at Serenade. Since I don't come around this area much ;)    I admire Desyree's passion in her creation of new flavors and the desire to showcase her talent in all that she does. Definitely, a place worth checking out!

Reviews.Author: Heather
Reviews.Content: Finally made it in to Desyree's new spot.  I had tried before, but I am usually on this side of town in the mornings and she isn't open until the afternoon so it hadn't worked out.  It is pretty much Art of Flavors 2.0.  Which is a good thing.  Still sweet Desyree smiling and offering sample after sample of her delicious flavors.  Each one more amazing than the last.  I had thai tea and black sesame.  The kiddos got cookies and cream and coconut and pandan kit kat.  Everything was perfect as always.  I'm so happy Desyree is back doing her thing.

Reviews.Author: Debbie
Reviews.Content: I am so glad Desyree is back in action! She and all her gelatos were missed.   If you have not been, get out from under your rock to check it out!  If you have, you know how wonderful it is.   Just like before, there are sweet flavors and savory flavors. Flavors change practically daily but you can be in the know if you follow them on Facebook or Instagram. My favorites include Stracciatella, Gorgonzola and Pear, and Creme Brulee.   What's new is that she is offering macarons (from another local business), and sweet pastries, such as panettone, biscotti, cookies, and more.   What's nice is that there is plenty of parking in this shopping center.   Looking forward to the tried and true classic flavors, as well as the new innovative flavors!

Reviews.Author: Yvonne
Reviews.Content: Best Gelato in town!!! If you are near Rainbow and Durango you HAVE to stop by and try it!  If you are not in the area and are in the mood for Gelato - it's worth the drive! It's creamy it's smooth, not super sweet... Very creative flavors.  Follow her of Facebook for daily flavors!

Reviews.Author: Candace
Reviews.Content: The Skinny: this place is THE place to get your gelati in Las Vegas. Sporting unique flavors, this place is the equivalent of Willy Wonka's factory for gelati. You won't find this kind of joint any where else.(5).  I was super depressed when Desiree left Art of Flavors downtown. But I heard that she opened Gelatology, I was ecstatic! And now, she not only offers the best Gelati in town, she also sells pastries and whoopee ice cream sandwiches too! Sweet!  For those not in the know, the gelati here is phenomenal in texture and execution. The joy is also coming here and seeing different stuff all the time. (We came in one day and got roasted peach cheesecake/organic sapphire grape/green tea Oreo. Two days later, most of the flavors are different and we got pineapple sorbetto/spicy chocolate/berry lemon pound cake).   Desiree is the Willy Wonka of gelati - amazingly, creative flavors which work all the time. Checking out interesting flavor combinations is part of the fun (garlic toast with honey, Thanksgiving dinner... say what?). The owners are great and will let you try everything. They understand that it is overwhelming with all the choices.  If you are a tourist and wonder if it is worth the trip from the Strip, I say a definite yes if you love ice cream. This is truly a local place that is unique to Vegas.  A large with 3 flavors will set you back $8.50. I heart this place...big time. 5 star review.

Reviews.Author: Caroline
Reviews.Content: Amazing! If you love gelato you must try this place! I had the chocolate birthday cake.

Reviews.Author: Monina
Reviews.Content: My friend Marlon told me about this place. I'm always skeptic about gelato places because they all usually taste the same way.   But not this place, OMG to all their amazing flavors. My first visit is when I bought a Blueberry gelato and I forgot the other flavor that I mixed it with. Today I stop by and they've changed some of their flavors and added a super delicious gelato.   Lady was s nice and let me try Ferrero, Goat Cheese and Fig and also the Cabernet Sauvignon both of them are made in half batches. Because I wanted a refreshing feel, I ended up getting the Goat Cheese and Fig which is so good.  Try this place, you will never be disappointed.

Reviews.Author: Scott
Reviews.Content: I give the place five stars for the gelato, five stars for the owner, a very pleasant lady who came over, introduced herself and asked how everything was while we were there but I would have given the place three stars at best after my second visit to Gelatology. On our first visit they had pumpkin gelato that we mixed with a hazelnut/ chocolate gelato (forgot exactly what it was called). It was excellent. Four days later we walked in to the place and they didn't have either one of these flavors. I thought it was odd not to have pumpkin as that should be a seasonal flavor to have this time of year. But worse was the way we were treated but a lady in a white cooks jacket. When we simply asked about the pumpkin and hazelnut gelato she started shaking her head as if we didn't know what we were taking about.  Bottom line, we'll be back but will look inside first and only do business when the boss is around.

Reviews.Author: Jen
Reviews.Content: Always saw this place driving since I lived around the area. One day I just decided I wanted to give this place a try and it was quite good ! We were greeted right away and offered many different flavors to sample what we want. Their flavors are also made fresh daily. The owner also gave us samples of their favored marshmallows.  will return again.

Reviews.Author: Perry
Reviews.Content: Amazing gelato. Must go !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Hmmmm friendly staff . They let you try whatever flavor you wanna try . New flavors daily .

Reviews.Author: July
Reviews.Content: During my visit to LV I yelped this location and was encouraged by the great reviews to give it a try. I must not be a Gelato lover cuz nothing convinced me. I came with a party of five (no pun intended) and everyone bought Gelato but I wasn't impressed. Amongst the flavors tried were: Wild Berry Lavender, Dark Cherry Tart, Bananas Foster,  Vietnamese Coffee, Cookies and Cream plus any flavors we were given to taste test.   Mostly everyone got the $7.00 size and thought it was too much; no one finished there's since it was too sweet. Overall 3.5 stars for the Gelato.  YET! 5 STARS for the customer service, they are super nice and let you try all the flavors your heart desires. I definitely can appreciate that. Peace out!

Reviews.Author: Jamielyn
Reviews.Content: First time and have to say they live up to their reviews. Can you believe over 300 reviews yet still a 5-star rating. Amazing! I had their avocado chocolate and it was simply delicious! It just melted in my mouth and leaving me wanting for more.

Reviews.Author: Rosy
Reviews.Content: Amazing place. !!  I'm just waiting for the  cream brûlée   Flavor!!  Waiting my favorite.

Reviews.Author: Luke
Reviews.Content: If I have to rate a course called  Gelatology , then I would probably give a solid B+.  Gelatology is located 10 miles away from the Strip (20 ~ 25 minutes drive) and the store name was inspired by the word  gelotology  (with three O's - means the study of laughter and its effects on the body).  I called the gelato shop location as the  wrong side of the plaza  - I drove into the plaza and had to slowly cruise my way to find this hidden store. Green Tea Kit Kat gelato is completely house-made and NOT the same as the one you find in Japanese supermarkets. Other interesting flavors I noticed include jalapeno cornbread, lemon poppyseed cake, and German chocolate cake.  Price: Quattro (4 oz, $4), sei (6 oz, $5.50), dodici (12 oz, $7), sedici (16 oz, $8.50). You can split two different flavors even with the smallest serving size. You can also choose other selection like liquid gelato bar (shakes), house soda,  coffees, and coppe (e.g. Fat Elvis [peanut butter gelato, strawberry puree, banana compote, bacon candy, peanut, croccantino, panna], Boscaiola [raspberry sorbetto, mint pesto, fruit macedonia, meringa], and Gelatology [pear and gorgonzola dolce gelato, oporto, sciroppo. caramelized walnut, roasted pears]).  ***  Pistachio and Fior de Latte ($4): Almost all flavors at Gelatology are made based on Fior de Latte (the key building block). Personally I think Fior de Latte is the best flavor here - simplicity at its finest. Now pistachio was good (due to its Fior de Latte base), but not the best gelato I've had (not as nutty as I would prefer).  ***  Gelatology isn't as good as other greatest gelato shops that I've tried in the past 2~3 years (Bianco Gelato in Miami, Bobboi Natural Gelato in La Jolla, Bulgarini Gelato in Los Angeles), but I still think Gelatology is still a great place to visit if you are craving for high quality gelato.  P.S. - No Wi-Fi available (as of July 2016).

Reviews.Author: Gigi
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and greeted us upon arrival. Offered for us to try as many samples. I had the cookie butter and it was phenomenal!!

Reviews.Author: Angel
Reviews.Content: This gelato place is really good. Besides gelato, they also sell baked goods, which I didn't try. My main focus was to get my hands on the gelato. The shop is off the strip and in this little mall. You can't see it from S Rainbow Blvd. You have to drive in and it's tucked in this little corner. The reason I came is because one of my Yeep friends recommended it and told me that they had interesting flavors.   Interesting flavors indeed! White Coffee Beans, Banana Foster, Cookie Butter, White Chocolate Candy Corn, and Pear & Gorgonzola to name a few. I settled for the White Coffee Beans and Ube combo. It was creamy and smooth. I preferred the White Coffee Beans over the Ube. The Ube didn't have a very strong flavor. The hubby got a sorbetto combo. I not sure what flavors he chose but it wasn't bad. It wasn't too tart and wasn't too sweet, right in the middle.  All the gelatos and sorbettos are made in house.

Reviews.Author: Marcie
Reviews.Content: Best gelato I've had! Owner is fun and talkative. I tried the pumpkin cheesecake and coffee! Must try! Very smooth and delicious.

Reviews.Author: Andrea
Reviews.Content: Really yummy gelato! They have a variety of different flavors. I tried the Nutella and captain crunch. Both were really good. Lots of flavor and creamy. For a small I got a lot of gelato. The owner was also very friendly and allowed us to same many different flavors before deciding on what we wanted to order. I thought it was really nice to go out of his way and talk to us. It made the experience very nice. If you're a gelato fan you should check this place out.

Reviews.Author: Ghia
Reviews.Content: Desyree has a very loyal following in the Las Vegas Valley. And for good reason too, she does gelato better than anyone else and her excellence shows in the details. My first experience here was not the best - Desyree was not present and the man serving me touched the gelato with his finger while scooping (but I still had a sample of it lol). There were also a ton of people behind the counter (more so than customers waiting to be served).  I had avoided the place for awhile until the newness kinks were worked out, but of course I was drooling as so many Yelpers posted their photos of their delicious treats and then I started following them on IG. I would frequently ask my husband every weeknight when the halo halo was available if we could go, but he'd say things like  Do you really need it?  and I'd say no, and open up my ice cream in the fridge. Thankfully, my friend was visiting from out of town and I had a legitimate excuse to go here again! She was intrigued by the pear & gorgonzola based on what I had shared with her, and she ended up getting The Gelatology Coppe that features it. She loved it and I also thought the savory flavors were intriguing when I sampled hers. I opted for the long craved for halo halo (thankfully it was in stock) and loved it! I've been complaining that a lot of Vegas places do not have beans in their halo halo, and although you cannot see it, the ube and sweet been flavors come through very well. I was also fortunate to try the li hing pineapple gelato (first time they were serving it). There was just a small portion left by the end of the night and I felt so lucky to be able to have it! Now I'm craving the li hing flavor for my sour candies. My husband, who is not a big gelato fan, ended up having some of mine and nodding his head in approval as he enjoyed the halo halo. Desyree was there this time to take care of us and I thought the experience went so much smoother. They have gelato pies available for this upcoming holiday season, so be sure to reserve one if you want to wow at those office potlucks.

Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: Not only is the gelato delicious but the owner is one of the nicest people I've met. We recently had an event at work and we served some gelato. Desiree got us exactly what we needed and everyone loved it. Next time you are having a party, I would definitely recommend Gelatology as a great place to consider got your dessert needs.

Reviews.Author: Natalie
Reviews.Content: Oh the wonders of Desyree... I finally made it to Gelatology and got to enjoy the works of my favorite gelato chef at her new (not so new anymore) location. I absolutely love Desyree's gelato. She has the most unique flavors and you taste the love she has for her craft in her creations.  During this trip I had Baklava with Pistachio's and Red Velvet. Both flavors were rich and represented their names in the best ways. Needless to say I overwhelmingly missed Desyree and her amazing gelato. Though I live on the other side of town, I will have to take a road trip for Gelatology a little more often.

Reviews.Author: Zoë
Reviews.Content: We're so glad Desyree is back! Her gelato is always delicious and creative. We drive 20-30 minutes to get to this new location, but we would drive further without hesitation.

Reviews.Author: Ron
Reviews.Content: Never disappoints! Always something new every week! I love how they encourage you to sample the different flavors - try a couple or try them all! They get quite busy after lunch time so plan accordingly. Try to come when it's not busy so you can try many flavors. Otherwise, you'll feel rushed and regret not trying one of the new flavors.

Reviews.Author: Joyce
Reviews.Content: Can you say AMAZING?  If it wasn't quite so expensive I would probably be here everyday or at least every other day.   But to be honest, I'm probably here 2xs a week at the very least.    The service is great!  Whoever is behind the counter never rushes people when they are trying out samples and extremely patient and friendly.  My usual is the cookies and cream which I get every time along with one of their daily specials.  I've tried a bunch of their different Ube mixes, the chocolate and a few more I can't quite remember.  And every single time it has been worth every cent!

Reviews.Author: LJ
Reviews.Content: Fine I'll be the first non 5 star.   It's great to hear that the creative brain that made Art Of Flavors all the rave finally reopened under another name Gelatology. I'm sure a lot of fans of the Desyree ran AOF are very excited and swarm the place every day since they've opened right here in the SW.   Inside your presented with a variety of unique gelato and sorbetto flavors. I'm definitely a fan of that, the unique flavors. At the time they had nutella rocky road, rosemary creme brulee, pear and gorgonzola cheese to name some of the flavors. You can sample pretty much all of them, though I try not to do so many at one time. Be on the look out for their flavors of the day.   I went with the peanut butter and espresso Liquid Gelato Bar. It's basically a shake. You can select from the salted caramel, cookies and cream, espresso, peanut butter, and fior di latte. I liked it. I'm easy to please and will probably do the cookies and cream next time.  I'm not to big of a fan as others hence the non 5 star but glad that she's back. She's very friendly and I wish her all the success with Gelatology. Maybe I'll stop by for a fat elvis or one the flavors of the day.

Reviews.Author: Cheryl
Reviews.Content: So good! The staff is really lovely and enthusiastic about giving samples and describing the flavors and ingredients used. The gelato is great! We were in Italy last month and ate Gelato there every day. This is just as good as it was there.  The flavors I have tried...... Sweet cream--simple and delicious  Carrot cake--amazing with chunks of soft cake and not over spiced  Grape--tastes just like real grapes only better because Gelato Cookies and cream--good Blueberry cheesecake -- just do it. So very good. I will be back to try more flavors. Impressed with this place.

Reviews.Author: Allen
Reviews.Content: It is a 20 minute drive from Summerlin, but it was worth the drive. It is a small shop inside a strip mall. There are about five small parlor tables inside. There is not much room inside when it gets busy.  The gelato was excellent. I tried the vegan peanut salted taffy. It was very good. They have several different flavors that change daily. They also have some flavors mixed together that I never seen before. You have to go there and check out the variety available.  I definitely recommend that you try this place.

Reviews.Author: Sabrina
Reviews.Content: Gelato. . .some people say that it is just like Ice Cream and I say NO!!  They are so different in flavor and texture. . .the actual make up of the ingredients. . .  Did you know that Gelato actually has less fat then normal Ice Cream?  Well it does.  Gelato tends to be made with more milk then heavy cream. . .like ice cream.  So if you want to think that Gelato is healthier for you then ice cream. . .in a sense. . .it actually is as it has less fat!  =)  You might also wonder then why is gelato so much creamier then ice cream?  Well it's the temperature that they serve it at.  Ice cream is normally served at 6-10 degrees F. . .while Gelato is served traditionally at 10-22 degrees F.  So OF COURSE, gelato feels and tastes creamier.    So now that the ice cream vs gelato lesson is over. . .=)  Let's get on with the review on the gelato!!  I have been here numerous times and they have never disappointed.  I have tried more flavors then I bought of course. . .since I tasted about 5-7 before buying a cup with 2 flavors in it. . .LOL    But the one that stands out is the Gorgonzola with pear. . .if you love gorgonzola cheese as much as I do. . .then you would have LOVED this one.  But remember once you have something and you love it. . .go back often as they change their flavors frequently!  Olive Oil gelato. . .one of my all time favorites!!  Yeah I tend to like sweets with a savory twist and this totally made my day!  I could tell they had used EVOO from the first cold press as the flavor of the EVOO was very very fresh and fruity!  LOVED it!  I also loved their caramel popcorn gelato. . .the flavors dead on. . .BUT I have to say that popcorn was a little soggy for me. . .  Peanut Butter. . .OMG. . .heavenly!!  So creamy!!  It tasted like you were eating heavenly light spoonfuls of peanut buttery goodness!!  In other words, I have yet to have anything that I did NOT like. . .I have some that I liked over others. . .BUT everything has been delicious!  Writing this review makes me wish that I had a large cup of gelati in front of me right now!!  =)  Ambiance. . .it is really cute and clean. . .very bright!  People taking my order have always been very friendly.    They seem to be branching out into other baked goods. . .sadly I can not write a review on those as I have never gotten past the gelati!    Seriously. . .go and get some!!!  Like right now. . .go get some!!!  =)

Reviews.Author: Jane
Reviews.Content: This place has been long over due for a visit and finally came with some friends. If anybody knows, Desyree had already established a reputation of being the queen of gelato for many years. I came here already having the same expectations and the understanding that it will be an awesome experience, as before when she was at a previous shop. I'm so glad this place is closer to my house and the service is on point. She lets you sample everything you want to ensure you get the right flavor. At the end, I decided to get the blueberry lemon and kit Kat sesame gelato. The combination of those two were like beautiful unicorns frolicking in your mouth and rainbows shooting out of your eyes. I was hoping that they had pistachio gelato since that is always my to go flavor, but this experience made me get something outside the box and be a rebel. This also gives me the excuse to go back and see what else they have. They do have new ice-cream/gelato cakes that I must go back for and try. Mmm... Can't wait.

Reviews.Author: Charlene
Reviews.Content: I love Desyree and her ability to create the most delicious and bizarre flavors and somehow incorporate them in gelato. I love that she remembers all her customers and takes the time to talk to you and appreciates the business you bring. I am constantly raving about this little gem to all my friends and co-workers and they in turn are doing the same. You really can't get any better than this.   I honestly hate that she has an instagram posting daily flavors because it forces me to get off my ass and drive all the way to her place. I've been here way too many times but I can't help it. The flavors are always intriguing and it's always fun to stop by on the weekends to see what savory flavors she comes up with.   My personal favorites are cookie butter, salted caramel, lychee, chocolate, pear and gorgonzola cheese... okay maybe all of them. And if I'm too lazy to scoop, I love getting the salted caramel shake. It's so creamy... it's seriously to die for.

Reviews.Author: Cliff
Reviews.Content: Dear Desyree: If you are reading this, it was such a pleasure meeting you yesterday!  On to my short review: Desyree warmly welcomed me into her shop and asked me if it was my first time there (it was). She then explained to me her methods and her madness and let me try a scoop of every single one of her flavors that she had that day! I felt bad because I went through so many of her little plastic spoons... I literally could not decide what I wanted to have, but ultimately decided on Peanut Butter. Very rich and flavorful. I was tempted to get another scoop of something else, but I really have to watch my figure! Service is a big deal to me. So when the product is good and the service is excellent, I will be returning and often. Next time I'm gonna try something more exotic that isn't found anywhere else.

Reviews.Author: Amber
Reviews.Content: Owners/staff are so warm n welcoming, great customer service. Not to mention, the best gelato i've ever had. They have gluten free/vegan etc options and great variety of flavors Fav one has to be Sage brown butter! Yum!
